content: louis & lilly slipovers designed by jenny watson 100% falkland islands wool measurements skill level age approximately abbreviations months tiny baby 0 - 3 3 - 6 6 - 12 12 - 24 beg beginning to fit chest cm centimeters cont continue cm / in 31 / 12 36 / 14 41 / 16 46 / 18 51 / 20 decrease decreas ing actual size approximately foll following in inch cm / in 41 / 16 46 / 18 52 / 20½ 57 / 22½ 61 / 24 increase increas ing full length k knit p purl cm / in 17 / 6½ 20 / 8 24 / 9½ 28 / 11 32 / 12½ psso pass slipped stitch over repeat repeat west yorkshire spinners bobble peep pure dk rem remaining mist 166 rs right side 1 2 2 2 3 50g hanks st s stitch es s1 slip one stitch knitways west yorkshire spinners bobble peep pure dk tbl through back of loop blackcurrant 319 decrease together 1 2 2 2 3 50g hanks ws wrong side materials 1x1 rib 1st row *k1 p1 repeat from * to last st k1 1 pair of 4mm uk8 us6 knitting needles 2nd row p1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end 1 pair of 3 25mm uk10 us3 knitting needles repeat 1st and 2nd row stitch holders 2 buttons for each garment st-st stocking stitch safety pin 1st row knit 2nd row purl gauge repeat 1st and 2nd row 22sts and 28 row to 10cm 4in over stocking stitch using 4mm knitting needles or the size required to give the correct gauge it is essential to work to the stated gauge in order to achieve the desired fabric and garment size you should always start by knitting a gauge square before knitting the full garment notes instructions are given for 31cm 12in larger sizes are given in square brackets yarn quantities are based on average requirements and are therefore approximate ages and skill levels are specified for guidance only next row purl repeat last 2 row 2 3 3 4 5 times more 6 7 10 10 10 sts work 4 4 8 8 8 row decrease 1 st at neck edge only in 3rd and every foll 0 0 4th 4th 4th row 5 6 8 8 8 sts work 2 4 2 2 4 row without shaping buttonhole border change to 3 25mm needles and proceed as follows - next row knit to end increase 2 3 3 3 3 sts evenly across row 7 9 11 11 11 sts commencing with 1st row of 1x1 rib a purl stitch will be at each end work 2 row next row rib 2 3 4 4 4 cast off 2sts rib 2 3 4 4 4 next row rib 3 4 5 5 5 cast on 2sts rib 2 3 4 4 4 work 3 row in rib cast off in rib with rs facing working on rem 23 26
